name: HD 181433
scenarioDescription:
The HD 181433 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 181433 is a star with 0.63 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.79 times its radius. It is located 87.74 light years away from the solar system.

HD 181433 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 181433 system


HD 181433 b

HD 181433 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 181433 b is 6.36 times the mass of Earth. At 6.36 Earth masses, HD 181433 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


HD 181433 c

HD 181433 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.76 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 181433 c is 203.52 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 181433 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 181433 d

HD 181433 d was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 181433 d is 171.72 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 181433 d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 181433, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
